times-29147-2d.clue: Classic beauty peculiar to English female — only her (5,2,4)

steps.hint: The legendary Spartan queen whose face launched a thousand ships
'Peculiar' suggests something odd or jumbled — a signal to rearrange letters

transforms.hint: 'To' is used as-is — it contributes both its letters to the anagram
In cryptics, 'English' is shortened to E — one of the most common single-letter abbreviations
In cryptics, 'female' is shortened to F — the standard abbreviation
'Only' is used as-is — all four letters feed into the anagram
'Her' is used as-is — all three letters feed into the anagram
Rearrange TO + E + F + ONLY + HER (11 letters) — 'peculiar' tells you to jumble them all

steps.failMessage: 'to English female only her' is 22 letters — far too many for 11. Some words must be abbreviations.

times-29147-1d.clue: Bloodless revolution for agents capturing base (7)

steps.hint: Lacking colour or vitality — pale and weak
'Capturing' tells you one piece grabs hold of another — wrapping around it
'Revolution' suggests turning things around — here it signals rearranging all the letters

transforms.hint: In cryptics, 'agents' points to CIA — the Central Intelligence Agency, the most famous spy agency
'Base' as in low or despicable — MEAN is a classic synonym
'Capturing' tells you CIA wraps around MEAN — CI + MEAN + A = CIMEANA
